content:
RibbonAutomationPeer Class

In this Article

Exposes Ribbon types to UI Automation.

Syntax

Declaration

public class RibbonAutomationPeer : System.Windows.Automation.Peers.SelectorAutomationPeer, System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IExpandCollapseProvider, System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISelectionProvider

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • DispatcherObject
  • AutomationPeer
  • UIElementAutomationPeer
  • FrameworkElementAutomationPeer
  • ItemsControlAutomationPeer
  • System.Windows.Automation.Peers.SelectorAutomationPeer
  • RibbonAutomationPeer

Constructors summary

RibbonAutomationPeer(Ribbon)

Initializes a new instance of the RibbonAutomationPeer class.

Properties summary

ExpandCollapseState

Gets the state, expanded or collapsed, of the control that is associated with this RibbonAutomationPeer.

Methods summary

Collapse()

Minimizes the Ribbon.
CreateItemAutomationPeer(Object)

Creates a RibbonTabDataAutomationPeer for the specified item.
Expand()

Restores the Ribbon.
GetAutomationControlTypeCore()

Gets the control type for the Ribbon that is associated with this RibbonAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationControlType*.
GetChildrenCore()

Gets the collection of child elements of the Ribbon that is associated with this RibbonAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetChildren*.
GetClassNameCore()

Gets the name of the Ribbon that is associated with this RibbonAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClassName*.
GetPattern(PatternInterface)

Gets the control pattern for the Ribbon that is associated with the RibbonAutomationPeer.
IsOffscreenCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the Ribbon that is associated with this RibbonAutomationPeer is off the screen.
SetFocusCore()

This API is not implemented.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

ISelectionProvider.CanSelectMultiple

Gets a value that specifies whether the Ribbon allows more than one child element to be selected concurrently.
ISelectionProvider.IsSelectionRequired

Gets a value that specifies whether the Ribbon requires at least one child element to be selected.

Constructors

  • RibbonAutomationPeer(Ribbon)

    Initializes a new instance of the RibbonAutomationPeer class.

    public RibbonAutomationPeer (System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon owner);

    Parameters

    • owner
      Ribbon

      The element associated with this automation peer.

Properties

  • ExpandCollapseState

    Gets the state, expanded or collapsed, of the control that is associated with this RibbonAutomationPeer.

    public System.Windows.Automation.ExpandCollapseState ExpandCollapseState { get; }

    Property Value

    • ExpandCollapseState

      The state of the control that is associated with this RibbonAutomationPeer.

Methods

  • Collapse()

    Minimizes the Ribbon.

    public void Collapse ();

    Remarks

    This method sets the IsMinimized property to true.

  • CreateItemAutomationPeer(Object)

    Creates a RibbonTabDataAutomationPeer for the specified item.

    protected override System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer CreateItemAutomationPeer (object item);

    Parameters

    • item
      Object

      An object that is in the Ribbon that is associated with this RibbonAutomationPeer.

    Returns

    • ItemAutomationPeer

      A RibbonTabDataAutomationPeer that is associated with the specified item.

  • Expand()

    Restores the Ribbon.

    public void Expand ();

    Remarks

    This method sets the IsMinimized property to false.

  • GetAutomationControlTypeCore()

    Gets the control type for the Ribbon that is associated with this RibbonAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationControlType*.

    protected override System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationControlType GetAutomationControlTypeCore ();

    Returns

    • AutomationControlType

      The AutomationControlType enumeration value.

  • GetChildrenCore()

    Gets the collection of child elements of the Ribbon that is associated with this RibbonAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetChildren*.

    protected override System.Collections.Generic.List<System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> GetChildrenCore ();

    Returns

    • List<AutomationPeer>

      The child elements of the Ribbon that is associated with this RibbonAutomationPeer.

    Remarks

    The GetChildrenCore method returns a collection of AutomationPeer objects that represent the ApplicationMenu, QuickAccessToolBar, and RibbonTab objects that belong to the Ribbon.

  • GetClassNameCore()

    Gets the name of the Ribbon that is associated with this RibbonAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClassName*.

    protected override string GetClassNameCore ();

    Returns

    • String

      The type name of the associated Ribbon.

  • GetPattern(PatternInterface)

    Gets the control pattern for the Ribbon that is associated with the RibbonAutomationPeer.

    public override object GetPattern (System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface patternInterface);

    Parameters

    • patternInterface
      PatternInterface

      A value enumeration that specifies the control pattern.

    Returns

    • Object

      If the stem.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.IsCollapsed* property of the Ribbon is false and patternInterface is the PatternInterface, PatternInterface, PatternInterface, or PatternInterface value, this method returns an object that supports the control pattern; otherwise, null.

  • IsOffscreenCore()

    Gets a value that indicates whether the Ribbon that is associated with this RibbonAutomationPeer is off the screen.

    protected override bool IsOffscreenCore ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the Ribbon is collapsed; otherwise, false.

  • SetFocusCore()

    This API is not implemented.

    protected override void SetFocusCore ();

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • ISelectionProvider.CanSelectMultiple

    Gets a value that specifies whether the Ribbon allows more than one child element to be selected concurrently.

    bool System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISelectionProvider.CanSelectMultiple { get; }

    Returns

    • Boolean

      false in all cases.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the RibbonAutomationPeer instance is cast to an ISelectionProvider interface.

  • ISelectionProvider.IsSelectionRequired

    Gets a value that specifies whether the Ribbon requires at least one child element to be selected.

    bool System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISelectionProvider.IsSelectionRequired { get; }

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true in all cases.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the RibbonAutomationPeer instance is cast to an ISelectionProvider interface.
